albums.title: Your Chance
albums.description: An album of songs we wrote almost 10 years from the time of this v4v release! Self produced with the help of our friend Anthony Picone, recorded in 2015. There are some cool musical ideas that we hope to revisit someday. We were still pretty young, our ages ranging from 17 to 26 and developing as musicians/songwriters, but it's fun to listen back and see what we were up to! www.doerfelverse.com

albums.title: Sail On: The Beach Boys Podcast
albums.description: Leading you further and further down the Beach Boys rabbit hole as gently and as thoroughly as humanly possible since 2017!

tracks.title: 92 - Thank You, Brian
tracks.summary:
Hello Friends,
I stood out of the way and let Brian tell his story with the help of our close friends and supporters of the pod.  Thank you all and thank you, Brian.  We love you.
Wyatt

Hello Friends!
Before the news of Brian's passing, Nia and I recorded this commentary track for the tenth anniversary of Love & Mercy.  It will hopefully be a lighthearted and fun way to celebrate Brian's life.  Please watch with us!
 
Thanks for listening!

tracks.title: 91 - Carl and the Passions – "So Tough" (Part 2)
tracks.summary:
Hello Friends!
The passion continues here at the Sail On Podcast!  I'm back in Tennessee!  Brian is sneaking around to record songs at other studios!  We learn all about what a "grease job" is!  And Will and John unveil a brand new Beach Boys villain from within the ranks!  Who could it be?  Only one way to find out!
 
Thanks for listening!
Wyatt

tracks.title: 90 - Carl and the Passions – "So Tough" (Part 1)
tracks.summary:
Hello Friends!
We're back with the long overdue and highly anticipated first part of our CARL AND THE PASSIONS discussion!  Our favorite normal men, Will and John have blessed us with some fantastic information from a very murky time in The Beach Boys career.  Will crashes out over Bruce's magnum opus!  PARENTAL ADVISORY: This episode is a raunchy one.  Marcella will do that to you!  Ask Bri!  She's fine, fine, fine, fine, fine, fine, fine!  
 
Thanks for listening!
Wyatt

tracks.title: 89 - The Flame(s)
tracks.summary:
Hello Friends!
It's finally here!  The sixth season of the Sail On Podcast!  We're bringing you the definitive history of South African band The Flames!  Or is it the Flame?  How did these guys come to be associated with The Beach Boys in the first place?  Did Ricky Fataar come out of the womb playing 30 different instruments?  Did Steve Desper ever sleep?  All this and more in this episode of your favorite podcast!
 
Thanks for listening!
Wyatt

tracks.title: Bonus Episode 9 - UNHINGED with Nia D’Emilio (Patreon Preview)
tracks.summary:
Hello Friends!
 
On this episode of Unhinged, we review, well, everything. Nia and special guest Trevor Hodge, mastermind behind sunshine surf pop band The Burkharts, talk Beach Boys songs, albums, and events in a rousing game of "This or That." Listen for the hottest takes on Wild Honey, a lot of praise for Sir Paul McCartney, an impossible choice between two infamous recording sessions, and a tease for a project that Nia and Trevor will work on within the next six years. And listen to The Burkharts if you haven't yet! Nia thinks their latest single "Valley Girl" is great!
 
Follow Nia!

tracks.title: METAL IN THE BANJO
tracks.subtitle: METAL IN THE BANJO
tracks.summary:
METAL IN THE BANJO by TJ Doerfel(Sir TJ The Wrathful)
I made this song for Sir Libre after somehow it came up in discussion that I should make a metal banjo song. It took on it's own sound, not exactly metal, but close enough. However, after over 25 hours of creating and producing it, my Macbook with all the projects files, it's hard drive died. I was unable to recover the project or anything else on it and after trying to remove the HD, smashed it with a hammer with wrath. I had saved a few semi-mixed versions, and decided to move forward and release it. 
Fun fact: 5 string banjos are surprisingly heavy, coming in at around 12 pounds. It's because other than the neck, it has a lot of metal pecies that help make up its tone.

albums.title: Beware of Banjo
albums.description:
In 2008, I locked myself in A room with a banjo and this is what came out. This is NOT typical, out of tune, twangy banjo music. I would say this is relaxing, acoustic, instrumental music. I made this as a solo project while performing with The Doerfels, the band I started with four of my younger brothers and our only sister. 
Anyways, If you dare to listen, Beware of Banjo!

If you receive any value from this music, which I loved making, please let me know with any kind of value! ITM TYFYC KTLD,

Sir TJ The Wrathful

tracks.title: The Dark Song(Live with The Doerfels)

albums.title: Generation Gap
albums.description:
Doug Yeomans is a Buffalo NY guitar legend. In 2009 when Ben Doerfel was 13 years old, Doug thought it would be cool to capture this time in a recording. Can you pick out the veteran from the 13 year old as they pick through these old traditional tunes? Doug is now part of the family as Ben married Dougs daughter, Emma in 2020. Anyways, I Hope you enjoy this magical album I had the honor of recording -  Sir TJ The Wrathful

Doerfels: https://www.doerfelverse.com
Doug Yoemans: https://dougyeomansmusic.com/
